sections.MISSION:
1/2CR Squadron Mortars conducts an emplacement of a Mortar Firing Point (MFP) on 10 AUG 2023 on PA 256N IOT refine Platoon SOPs prior to Saber Junction ’23.
Commander’s
sections.PURPOSE: of this operation is to maintain the momentum after Platoon STX by reinforcing mortar operations training and provide addition repetitions for the new privates prior to the CTC rotation.
sections.KEY TASKS:
Conduct PCC/PCIs of NVGs and Mortar Weapon Systems
Day and Night Occupation of MFP
Maintain local area security throughout operations
MFP Defense/React to Contact
sections.END STATE:
friendly forces retain combat power for follow on operations; platoon refines SOPs for Mortar Operations in split section, and increase overall platoon lethality.
Training Objectives
Conduct hasty TLPs and issue FRAGOs
Conduct the maneuver of a Platoon
React to direct fire contact while dismounted
Day and Night MFP Recon
Day and Night MFP Occupation

draw.overall_supervision_plan: I assess the overall initial risk to be low as a result of an seldom probability of a catastrophic event; I assess the overall residual risk to be low due to an unlikely probability of a catastrophic event.Most Dangerous Risk: Night MovementsMitigation: Ensure proper NVG care and serviceability before leaving for the field. Control the movement pace and provide clear route briefings to ensure leaders can all track progress during the movement. In case of difficult terrain, use appropriate lights and leader presenceMost Likely Risk: Slips, Trips, and Falls with Heavy EquipmentMitigation: Ensuring proper PPE is worn during operations and slowing down any nonessential movement to ensure soldiers move heavy equipment through the woods. Part of the mitigation will be to brief about weather conditions and empower soldiers to modify any surface deem unsafe before and during the training event. Moving a controlled rate in order to prevent slips, trips ,and fall.
